articles.title: Contra Costa sheriff says detainee mistreatment claims false
articles.description: RICHMOND, Calif. (AP) — The Contra Costa County sheriff says an investigation has found no evidence that federal immigration detainees were mistreated at a Richmond jail.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Contra Costa sheriff says detainee mistreatment claims false
articles.description: RICHMOND, Calif. (AP) — The Contra Costa County sheriff says an investigation has found no evidence that federal immigration detainees were mistreated at a Richmond jail. Sheriff David Livingston said Friday that after interviewing more than 100 witnesses and…

articles.author: By Nanette Asimov
articles.title: After probe, Contra Costa County Sheriff denies claims of mistreatment at jail
articles.description:
The Contra Costa County Sheriff's Office has completed an investigation of its own practices and announced Friday that it prevented no immigration detainees from using the bathroom and did not confine inmates to cells for 23 hours at a time.

                …

articles.title: Contra Costa sheriff investigating complaints by immigration detainees
articles.description:
The Contra Costa County Sheriff's Office is investigating claims of abuse by federal immigration detainees at the West County Detention Facility in Richmond.

articles.title: East Bay Congressman Wants Federal Probe of ICE Detainee Abuse Claims at Contra Costa Jail
articles.description: Rep. Mark DeSaulnier (D-Concord) plans to ask the U.S. Department of Justice to investigate claims that federal immigration detainees at a Contra Costa County jail have been mistreated.DeSaulnier

articles.title: Congressman calls for federal inquiry into treatment of women at immigration jail
articles.description: A Congressman is calling for a federal inquiry into reports of immigrant women being locked up for 23 hours a day and forced to use plastic bags for toilets.

articles.author: By Annie Ma
articles.title: Contra Costa sheriff says banned group broke jail rules in visiting immigrants
articles.description:
Contra Costa County Sheriff's officials said Thursday that it revoked an advocacy group's access to immigration detainees because volunteers violated guidelines that limit interactions with inmates.

articles.title: Woman convicted of murder found dead in Contra Costa cell
articles.description: RICHMOND, Calif. (AP) — Authorities say a 74-year-old woman convicted of killing her sister in the San Francisco Bay Area after traveling from Washington state was found hanging in her jail cell.

articles.title: More than half of Bay Area opposes crackdown on immigrants, new poll says
articles.description: Of the 1,000 registered voters in the nine-county Bay Area who took the poll in March and April, 55 percent disagree with the government's crackdown on undocumented immigrants.
